processed_hadiths.english_translation: Chapter heading regarding His saying: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth (Surah al-Nur 35)

potential_issues.impact: Not a complete hadith transmission, merely a section divider

Topics: Chapter heading on Allah as the Light of the heavens and earth

processed_hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jabir ibn Zayd: Ibn Abbas was asked about the saying of Allah: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. Ibn Abbas, al-Hasan, Qatadah, Amr ibn Muhammad, Abu Muslim al-Makki, and Mujahid said: Allah is the justice of the heavens and the earth, and He is the Guide of those in the heavens and the earth. Like His saying: The example of His light, and there is no example for Him, rather He means the example of His justice. As for His saying: Except that Allah comes to them in clouds from the cloud and the angels, al-Kalbi narrated from Abu Salih saying: He comes to them with His command and judgment to separate between them. And this is the statement of al-Hasan and Mujahid. And likewise His saying: And your Lord came, meaning: with His command and judgment. Ibn Abbas, al-Hasan, Abu Salih, and Amr said: And the meaning of your Lord came means: And the command of your Lord came, meaning His judgment. And Allah said: And indeed We came to them with the Book, meaning: The messengers came to them. And the evidence for that is the saying of Allah in another verse: Do they await except that the angels come to them or that the command of your Lord comes? And Hushaym was asked about that, so he said: They used to say: And the command of your Lord came, meaning His judgment. And He said: Have they not seen that We come to the earth reducing it from its extremities? And He said: So Allah came to their building from the foundations. And He said: So Allah came to them from where they had not reckoned.

narrators.name: Ibn Abbas
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Direct transmission from Jabir to Ibn Abbas

potential_issues.issue: Mawquf attribution stopping at Companion level
potential_issues.impact: The narration does not extend to the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.issue: Long scholarly exposition with multiple interpretations
potential_issues.impact: While narrators are reliable, the extensive commentary reflects later scholarly analysis mixed with Companion interpretation

Topics: Interpretation of Allah as the Light of heavens and earth
Multiple scholarly views on the meaning of light
Explanation of how Allah's coming means His command and judgment
Quranic verses illustrating metaphorical coming of Allah

processed_hadiths.english_translation: Chapter heading regarding His saying: My Lord, show me so I may look upon You (Surah al-A'raf 143)

potential_issues.impact: Not a complete hadith transmission, merely a section divider

Topics: Chapter heading on Moses's request to see Allah

processed_hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jabir: Ibn Abbas was asked about the saying of Allah: My Lord, show me so I may look upon You. He said: That was by way of apology to his people so that Allah might show them a sign from His signs and they would despair from seeing Allah.

narrators.name: Ibn Abbas
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

Topics: Ibn Abbas's interpretation of Moses's request to see Allah
Explanation that it was an apology to his people
Incident of the mountain in the Quranic narrative

processed_hadiths.english_translation: Umayr ibn Ismail from Ibrahim narrated: Abu Salih narrated to us from Ibn Abbas and from Jubayr from al-Dahhak regarding His saying: Glory be to You, I repent to You, meaning from my request that I look upon You. And I am the first of the believers who attest that You cannot be seen by anyone. And Mujahid said the same. And al-Hasan said: You will not see me, and it is not fitting for any human to see me. Al-Rabi' ibn Habib said: Shall not is a letter of despair according to grammarians and linguists, meaning he will not see him anyone in this world nor in the next. As for His saying: When his Lord revealed Himself to the mountain, meaning: When some of His signs were revealed, and the mountain could not bear them until it became leveled, and Moses fell unconscious, and when he awoke, he said: Glory be to You, I repent to You from my request, and I am the first of the believers, so it is not fitting for a human to see Him. And Mujahid said: His command was revealed to the mountain so He made it leveled. And Ibn Abbas said: The first of the believers that You cannot be seen in this world nor in the next.

narrators.name: Ibn Abbas
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Use of passive voice indicates unclear direct source
Mawquf narration with multiple interpretations appended

Multiple interpretations from various scholars mixed with transmission

Topics: Moses's repentance for asking to see Allah
Ibn Abbas and others' interpretation of the Quranic narrative
Linguistic analysis of the word shall not (lann)
The mountain's incapacity to bear Allah's manifestation
